channel.title: Dear Kafka on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Dear Kafka on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Chapter 1
item.description: Kyton The eyes were always there. Not real eyes, not reflections in a rain-slicked window or the passing glance of a stranger on the street. These were heavier. They pressed against the inside of his skull, a phantom weight behind his own gaze. Freedom? Freedom was a word for people who didn’t carry their own courtroom inside their head. Kyton was a man who could disappear any day. No one would notice or care.
